truth: -  "In many Western cultures, it's considered polite to make eye contact when speaking to someone."
fiction: -  "In many Western cultures, it's considered polite to make animal noises when speaking to someone."

truth: -  "In Thailand, it's considered disrespectful to touch someone's head, as it's seen as the most sacred part of the body."
fiction: -  "In Thailand, it's considered disrespectful to touch someone's elbow, as it's seen as the most sacred part of the body."

truth: -  "In many Middle Eastern countries, it's considered taboo to show the soles of your feet or shoes."
fiction: -  "In many Middle Eastern countries, it's considered taboo to show the palms of your hands."

truth: -  "In Japan, it's considered rude to blow your nose in public."
fiction: -  "In Japan, it's considered rude to blink in public."

truth: -  "In India, it's a social norm to eat with your right hand, as the left hand is considered unclean."
fiction: -  "In India, it's a social norm to eat with your feet, as the hands are considered unclean."

truth: -  "In China, it's considered good luck to give gifts in pairs, as the number two is considered lucky."
fiction: -  "In China, it's considered good luck to give gifts in multiples of seven, as the number seven is considered lucky."

truth: -  "In many African cultures, it's considered disrespectful to point at someone with your index finger."
fiction: -  "In many African cultures, it's considered disrespectful to point at someone with your pinky finger."

truth: -  "In Russia, it's considered bad luck to shake hands over a threshold."
fiction: -  "In Russia, it's considered bad luck to shake hands while wearing a hat."

truth: -  "In Greece, it's considered a taboo to hand someone a knife directly, as it's seen as a sign of conflict."
fiction: -  "In Greece, it's considered a taboo to hand someone a spoon directly, as it's seen as a sign of conflict."

truth: -  "In many Muslim cultures, it's considered disrespectful to enter a mosque with shoes on."
fiction: -  "In many Muslim cultures, it's considered disrespectful to enter a mosque with glasses on."

truth: -  "In South Korea, it's considered rude to pour your own drink when eating in a group."
fiction: -  "In South Korea, it's considered rude to pour your own soup when eating in a group."

truth: -  "In many Native American cultures, it's considered disrespectful to point at a rainbow, as it's seen as a spiritual entity."
fiction: -  "In many Native American cultures, it's considered disrespectful to point at a cloud, as it's seen as a spiritual entity."

truth: -  "In Italy, it's considered bad luck to place bread upside down on the table."
fiction: -  "In Italy, it's considered bad luck to place pasta upside down on the table."

truth: -  "In France, it's considered polite to say 'Bon appétit' before starting a meal."
fiction: -  "In France, it's considered polite to say 'Bon voyage' before starting a meal."

truth: -  "In Australia, it's considered disrespectful to climb Uluru, a sacred Aboriginal site."
fiction: -  "In Australia, it's considered disrespectful to swim in the Great Barrier Reef, a sacred Aboriginal site."

truth: -  "In Brazil, it's considered bad luck to walk backwards, as it's believed to invite bad spirits."
fiction: -  "In Brazil, it's considered bad luck to hop on one foot, as it's believed to invite bad spirits."

truth: -  "In many Jewish cultures, it's considered disrespectful to write the name of God."
fiction: -  "In many Jewish cultures, it's considered disrespectful to write the name of Moses."

truth: -  "In the Maori culture of New Zealand, it's considered taboo to sit on tables, as they're seen as a place for eating."
fiction: -  "In the Maori culture of New Zealand, it's considered taboo to sit on chairs, as they're seen as a place for eating."

truth: -  "In many Buddhist cultures, it's considered disrespectful to touch a monk, especially for women."
fiction: -  "In many Buddhist cultures, it's considered disrespectful to touch a tree, especially for women."
